column1: Smoque BBQ////The brisket is pretty good. By Chicago standards
column2: I think it's pretty famously good. The sliced brisket has a strip of fat through it which weirds me out
column3: but I'm easily weirded out by fat. I will carve a brand new cut of meat out of a steak if it's served with any normal amount of fat on the edges... and I certainly carve the fat out of this brisket. But this probably only reflects poorly on me
column4: and not on Smoque or most other restaurants
